Mayelana nelungelo lokuthola imfundo engaphezu kweyisisekelo uHulumeni akabophekile ukuyenza itholakale kumuntu wonke khona manjalo. UHulumeni ubopheke kuphela ukuba athathe izinyathelo ezisesilinganisweni esikahle njengoba isikhathi sihamba ukwenza lezo zikhungo zitholakale.

 

Njengoba ilungelo lokuthola imfundo eyisisekelo lingelomuntu wonke, aligcini kuzakhamuzi kuphela kodwa lisebenza nakulabo abangezona izakhamuzi. Ngaphezu kwaloko, ilungelo lokuthola imfundo eyisisekelo alipheleli ekutholeni indawo ezikoleni kuphela, kodwa futhi lihlanganisa nokufinyelela izinto zokufundisa nokuqinisekisa ukuthi zonke izikhungo zikufanelekele ukufunda.
zu.snippet: Lesi sigaba sihlinzeka ngokuthi wonke umuntu unelungelo lokuthola imfundo eyisisekelo kanye nemfundo engaphezu kweyisisekelo, leyo uhulumeni, ngokuthatha izinyathelo ezisesilinganisweni esikahle, okumele ayenze itholakale ngokuqhubekayo futhi ifinyeleleke.
zu.title: Isigaba 29: Imfundo
zu.topic_meaning:
Isigaba 29 soMthetho-sisekelo sihlinzekela amalungelo emfundo futhi sibalula ukuthi wonke umuntu unelungelo lokuthola imfundo eyisisekelo nemfundo engaphezu kweyisisekelo leyo uhulumeni, ngokuthatha izinyathelo ezisesilinganisweni esikahle, okumele ayenze itholakale ngokuqhubekayo futhi ifinyeleleke.

Isigaba 29 (2) soMthetho-sisekelo sibuye sihlinzeke ukuthi wonke umuntu unelungelo lokuthola imfundo nganoma luphi ulimi olusemthethweni alukhethayo, lapho loku ngokwesilinganiso esikahle kunokwenzeka khona. Leli yiphuzu elifakiwe elibalulekile ngoba ngesikhathi sombuso wobandlululo kwakuqashelwa isiNgisi nesiBhunu kuphela njengezilimi ezisemthethweni nokufundiswa ngazo. Nokho, leli lungelo linezithiyo zangaphakathi futhi liye laba yindaba yeziningi izimpikiswano ezingokomthetho.

Okokugcina, isigaba 29(3) soMthetho-sisekelo sinika ukuvikeleka kwelungelo lokumisa izikole ezizimele uma nje lezo zikole: i) zingabandlululi ngokohlanga; ii) zibhalisa kuHulumeni futhi iii) zilondoloza izindinganiso ezifanelekile. Okubalulekile, uHulumeni akanasibopho sokuhlinzeka ngezinsiza kulezo zikole ngenxa yokuthi zisebenza ngezindleko zazo kanti uHulumeni umane nje unesibopho sokungenzi (negative duty) esiwukuthi angagxambukeli kulezo zikole.

zu.interpretation: Ngaphansi kwenkolelo yokuba ngaphezulu kwako konke komthetho-sisekelo, yonke imithetho kumele ivumelane noMthetho-sisekelo kanye noHla Lwamalungelo olukuwo uMthetho-sisekelo. Manje izinkantolo seziyakwazi ukusho ukuthi umthetho oshayiwe nendlela yokuziphatha kuyinto engenakusebenza uma kwehluleka ukuhambisana naloko okuhlinzekwe kuMthetho-sisekelo.
zu.snippet: UMthetho-sisekelo uwumthetho weRiphabliki ongaphezu kwako konke okunye.
zu.title: Isigaba 2: Ubukhulu boMthetho-sisekelo
zu.topic_meaning:
Isigaba 2 soMthetho-sisekelo esaziwa ngokuthi wumshwana wokwengamela konke okunye, siyingxenye yezinhlinzeko eziyisisekelo zohlelo olusha olungokomthetho-sisekelo lwaseNingizimu Afrika. Siqinisekisa ukuthi uMthetho-sisekelo uwumthetho wezwe omkhulu ngaphezu kwayo yonke eminye; uma nanoma muphi omunye umthetho (umthetho kahulumeni, umthetho-mvama noma umthetho ongokwesiko) ungqubuzana nawo, okushiwo wuMthetho-sisekelo yiko okuyosebenza.

Lesi sigaba siphinde siqinisekise ukugqashuka ngokucacile enkolelweni yokuzimela geqe kwephalamende. Ngaphansi kwenkolelo yokuzimela geqe kwephalamende, iPhalamende lalinamandla okwenza nanoma muphi umthetho eliwufisayo futhi okuwukuphela kwento inkantolo eyayingayenza kwakuwukusho ukuthi lowo mthetho awusebenziseki nakhona likwenza ngezisekelo eziyingcosana. Ngenkathi yombuso wobandlululo eNingizimu Afrika kwakusebenza ukuzimela geqe kwephalamende. Ngaleso sizathu imithetho eyayishaywa yiPhalamende yayivuna kuphela loko okusiza abelungu kanti bambalwa futhi ingawanaki amalungelo abo bonke abantu bezinye izinhlanga. IZinkantolo zazingakwazi ukuthi umthetho awusebenziseki ngesizathu sokwephula kwawo amalungelo abantu; zazingasho kuphela ukuthi uMthetho awusebenziseki uma kukhona izihibe endleleni yokuwusebenzisa.

zu.mechanism: It is, however, subject to the condition that these rights may not be exercised in a way that is inconsistent with other fundamental human rights guaranteed in the Bill of Rights. For instance, the right to exercise a cultural practice must be consistent with an individual’s right to dignity and freedom and security of the person. If the right is practised in a manner that endangers a person’s life then it is inconsistent with the constitutional protection afforded in terms of section 30 of the Constitution and the State can intervene to protect an individual.
zu.snippet: Lesi sigaba sinika ukuvikeleka kwelungelo lokusebenzisa ulimi lwakho nokubamba iqhaza ekuphileni okungokwesikompilo kokuzikhethela.
zu.title: Isigaba 30: Ulimi namasiko
zu.topic_meaning: Isigaba 30 soMthetho-sisekelo sivikela ilungelo lokusebenzisa komuntu ulimi lwakhe kanye nokubamba iqhaza ekuphileni kwesikompilo kokuzikhethela. Leli ngelinye lamalungiselelo ahlukahlukene akuMthetho-sisekelo anika ukuvikeleka emaqenjini abantu ngokobuzwe bendabuko (ethnic), ngokwenkolo nangokolimi eNingizimu Afrika futhi sibonisa nokuzibophezela emthethwenbi wamazwe sokunika ukuvikeleka kwalawo maqembu.

zu.interpretation: Isigaba 31 soMthetho-sisekelo sivikela kokubili izifiso ezingokwesikompilo, inkolo nolimi zomuntu ngamunye kanye nezomphakathi. Ukuze umuntu ngamunye akileyime la malungelo ngokwalesi sigaba, loyo muntu kudingeka aveze ubufakazi bokuthi kukhona ukuxhumana phakathi kwakhe nawo. Kanti futhi isigaba 31 soMthetho-sisekelo sisekelwe ngokukhethekile enhlamvini (article) 27 yeSivumelwano Samazwe Ngamalungelo Kwezomphakathi Nakwezepolitiki (International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights) okwenza ukuvikeleka ngokomthetho-sisekelo okunikwa imiphakathi yamasikompilo, inkolo nolimi kuhambisana nomthetho wamazwe.
zu.mechanism: La malungelo akumele asetshenziswe ngendlela engqubuzana nanoma ziphi ezinye izinto ezihlinzekwe oHleni Lwamalungelo (Bill of Rights). Ngokwesibonelo, uma inkambiso engokwenkolo yomphakathi ilimaza ukuphila komuntu, khona-ke isigaba 31 soMthetho-sisekelo asikwazi ukuba namandla ngaphezu kwelungelo lomuntu ngamunye lenkululeko nokulondeka komuntu uma ngabe leli lungelo libekeka engozini. Abantu akumele basebenzise la malungelo ngendlela ethiya amalungelo abanye ngokungenasisekelo esizwakalayo.
zu.snippet: Lesi sigaba sinika ukuvikeleka kubantu bemiphakathi ehlukene ngokwesikompilo, inkolo noma ulimi.
zu.title: Isigaba 31: Imiphakathi yamasiko, izinkolo kanye nezilimi ezithile
zu.topic_meaning: Isigaba 31 soMthetho-sisekelo sinika ukuvikeleka kubantu bemiphakathi ehlukene ngokwesikompilo, inkolo noma ulimi. Abantu balawo maqembu akufanele banqatshelwe ilungelo lokujabulela isikompilo labo, baqhube inkolo yano futhi basebenzise ulimi lwabo. UMbuso awuvumelekile ukuphazamisa amalungelo abantu balawo maqembu ukuba bakhe futhi balondoloze izinhlangano zesikompilo, inkolo noma ulimi.

zu.legislation: The State is furthermore obliged to enact national legislation to give effect to this constitutional right and the Promotion of Access to Information Act 2 of 2000 (PAIA) specifically gives effect to this right. A person who wishes to access information held by the State or a private institution will be required to follow the procedures set out in PAIA.
zu.snippet: Lesi sigaba siqinisekisa wonke umuntu ngelungelo lokuthola noma luphi ulwazi (information) olugcinwe wuHulumeni kanye nanoma luphi ulwazi olugcinwe ngomunye umuntu oludingekela ukusetshenziswa noma ukuvikelwa kwanoma maphi amalungelo.
zu.title: Isigaba 32: Ukuthola ulwazi
zu.topic_meaning:
Isigaba 32 soMthetho-sisekelo siqinisekisa wonke umuntu ngelungelo lokuthola noma luphi ulwazi (information) olugcinwe wuHulumeni kanye nanoma luphi ulwazi olugcinwe ngomunye umuntu oludingekela ukusetshenziswa noma ukuvikelwa kwanoma maphi amalungelo.

 

Kubalulekile ukunaka ukuthi ukuqinisekiswa kwaleli lungelo elingokomthetho-mthetho kuwukuzimisela ukugqashuka ebushiqeleni bukahulumeni wobandlululo. Ukufinyeleleka kolwazi (access to information) kubaluleke kakhulu ekuqinisekiseni ukuthi lezo zinto ezingamagugu (values) ngokomthetho-sisekelo okuwukuthi ukulandisa, ukungafihli (transparency) nokwenza ngokukhululekile (openness) ziyafezwa futhi kuyithuluzi elinamandla lokusetshenziswa ekulwisaneni nenkohlakalo. Ngokwengxenye, ilungelo lokuthola ulwazi lisekelwe esimisweni sokuthi umuntu kufanele avunyelwe ukuthola ulwazi olumayelana naye ngokukhethekile, noma ngomqondo osabalele, ulwazi uHulumeni alusebenzisa ekwenzeni lezo zinqumo ezingase zimthinte umuntu noma umphakathi kabanzi.

zu.interpretation: Okwenziwa yiminyango noma izakhiwo zombuso kusho ukusetshenziswa kwamandla okulawula umphakathi ezinhlaka zoMbuso kanye nezinye izikhulu zikahulumeni. Kubhekiswe endleleni labo abasebenza kule minyango nezakhiwo abaziphatha ngayo ekwenzeni umsebenzi wabo wansuku zonke njengoba inemiphumela ewumthelela kubantu ngabanye noma amaqembu. Loku kwehlukile kuloko okwenziwa yizikhulu, okuwukuthi, izenzo zalabo abasemagunyeni lapho besebenzisa amandla abo, ngokuvamile okubandakanya ukusebenzisa imithetho eshayiwe kanye nokwakhiwa kwenqubomgomo. Lezo zenzo azibhekwa busha njengokwenziwa yiminyango yombuso kanye nezakhiwo, kodwa nazo zinako ukubhekisiswa ngendlela yokwahlulela kodwa ngaphansi kwezisekelo ezixegisiwe kancane.
zu.legislation: The State is obliged to enact national legislation to give effect to section 33 of the Constitution and the Promotion of Administrative Justice Act 3 of 2000 was enacted to give effect to these rights. Certain acts do not fall under “administrative action” and are not reviewable in terms of the Promotion of Administrative Justice Act. This includes judicial acts (such as presiding over cases) by the judiciary; acts by the President when exercising his inherent powers conferred by the Constitution, such as appointing commissions of inquiry or granting presidential pardons; acts by the legislature when exercising their primary functions; and purely political decisions by cabinet.
zu.snippet: Lesi sigaba siqinisekisa wonke umuntu ngelungelo lokuphathwa yiminyango nezakhiwo zombuso ngendlela efanelekile, enokucabangela okuhle nelandela inqubo enobulungisa.
zu.title: Isigaba 33: Ukuphatha ngokusemthethweni okulungileyo
zu.topic_meaning:
Isigaba 33 soMthetho-sisekelo siqinisekisa wonke umuntu ngelungelo lokuphathwa yiminyango nezakhiwo zombuso ngendlela efanelekile, enokucabangela okuhle nelandela inqubo enobulungisa futhi sinika abantu ngabanye ilungelo lokucela izizathu lapho amalungelo abo eye anyathelwa khona yiminyango noma izakhiwo zombuso. Leli lungelo liqinisekisa ukuthi kulandelwa izinqubo ezifanele lapho kwenziwa izinqumo eminyangweni noma izakhiwo zombuso, nanokuthi lezo zinqumo zifanelekile futhi zinokucabangela okuhle. Indlela eyinhloko leli lungelo elifezekiswa ngayo iwukuba kube khona ukubhekwa busha kokwahlulela kwaloko okwenziwe wumnyango wombuso noma isakhiwo.

Ukwenziwa umthetho ohleliwe kwaleli lungelo elingokomthetho-sisekelo lokuba umuntu athole ubulungisa eminyangweni noma izakhiwo zombuso kubonakalisa ukuzimisela ngokubekela amandla amakhulu ezikhulu eziphethe imingcele. Umbuso wobandlululo wawaziwa ngokuthi uhulumeni wayesebenzisa amandla angenamkhawulo. Ngokuphambene, ngaphansi kohlelo olusha lomthetho-sisekelo lweNingizimu Afrika, lawo mandla kumele ahambisane noMthetho-sisekelo futhi kumele asetshenziswe ngokufanele, abe nokucabangela okuhle futhi alandele inqubo enobulungisa.

zu.interpretation:
Leli lungelo elingokomthetho-sisekelo alinakuhunyushwa ngokuthi umuntu angaya kunoma yiphi inkantolo noma inkundla ezimele ukuze kuxazululwe impikiswano ethile, ngenxa yokuthi isasebenza imithetho yegunya (jurisdiction) (okuwukuthi, imithetho elawula ukuthi yiyiphi inkantolo enokuqula luphi udaba). Nokho, umuntu unalo ilungelo lokuya enkantolo efanelekayo noma inkundla lapho kufaneleka khona, ukuze kuxazululwe impikiswano futhi akanakuphoqwa ukuba alilahle leli lungelo.

 

UHulumeni unesibopho sokwenza kube lula ukutholakala kobulungisa ngokuthi athathe izinyathelo zokushaya umthetho noma okunye.
zu.snippet: Lesi sigaba siqinisekisa wonke umuntu ngelungelo lokubai impikiswano anayo yomthetho inqunywe ngokuqulwa obala ngokunobulungisa ngaphambi kwenkantolo noma isithangami esifanelekile.
zu.title: Isigaba 34: Ukufinyelela ezinkantolo
zu.topic_meaning:
Isigaba 34 soMthetho-sisekelo siqinisekisa wonke umuntu ngelungelo lokuba noma yiphi impikiswano anayo enokuxazululwa ngokusebenzisa umthetho inqunywe ngokuqulwa obala ngokunobulungisa ngaphambi kwenkantolo noma, lapho kufaneleka khona, inkundla efanelekile noma isithangami.

Leli lungelo liyingxenye ebaluleke kakhulu yomthetho. Leli lungelo libalulekile uma kuqhathaniswa nokulahlelwa ngaphandle kwegunya lezinkantolo okuyinto eyayivumelekile ngenkathi yombuso wobandlululo. Lesi sigaba sakha ilungelo lenqubo efanele yokulandelwa ebizela ukuba kube khona ukuqulwa kodaba esidlangalaleni nokunobulungisa. Nokho, nanoma luphi udaba olulethwa ngaphambi kwenkantolo kumele lukwazi ukuxazululwa ngokusebenzisa umthetho.

zu.snippet: Lesi sigaba sihlinzeka amalungelo kubantu ababoshiwe, abavalelwe kanye nabamangalelwe.
zu.title: Isigaba 35: Abantu ababoshiwe, abavalelwe nababekwe amacala
zu.topic_meaning:
Inkambiso yezobulungisa mayelana nokwephulwa komthetho iye yashintshwa kakhulu ngaphansi kohlelo olusha lomthetho-sisekelo eNingizimu Afrika futhi ineziqinile izikhonkwane nemigoqo okubekelwe ukuqinisekisa ukuthi amandla kahulumeni awasetshenziswa kabi. Ngokukhethekile, isigaba 35 soMthetho-sisekelo sihlinzeka amalungelo kubantu ababoshiwe, abavalelwe kanye nabamangalelwe futhi uhlu lwamalungelo angokomthetho-sisekelo akulesi sigaba asebenza kuphela uma umuntu ewela kwesinye salezi zigaba.

 

Ngokwesibonelo, isigaba 35(1) (a) soMthetho-sisekelo sihlinzeka ngokukhethekile ukuthi umuntu oboshwe ngoba kuthiwa unecala lokwephula umthetho unelungelo lokungasho lutho kuhlanganise namanye amalungelo ahlukahlukene anjengokuthi akanakuphoqelelwa ukuvuma noma yini enokusetshenziswa njengobufakazi obumlahlayo. Abantu abavalelwe ngokwesigaba 35(2) soMthetho-sisekelo, kuhlanganise wonke umuntu ogwetshiwe, banelungelo lokuba batshelwe ngokushesha ukuthi bavalelwa ngasizathu sini futhi umuntu omangalelwe ngokwesigaba 35(3) soMthetho-sisekelo unelungelo lokuba icala lakhe liqulwe ngokunobulungisa okuhlanganisa namanye amalungelo ahlukahlukene njengelungelo lokwaziswa ukuthi yini amangalelwe ngayo futhi kube nemininingwane eyanele ukuze akwazi ukuphendula kanye namalungelo okuthathwa komuntu njengongenalo icala nokungaphoqelelwa ukuba anike ubufakazi bokuzilahla ngokwakhe.

 

Isigaba 35(5) soMthetho-sisekelo sihlinzeka ikhambi ngokwephulwa kwamalungelo angokomthetho-sisekelo futhi sibalula ukuthi ubufakazi obutholwe ngendlela eyephula noma liphi ilungelo elisoHleni Lwamalungelo (Bill of Rights) kumele libekwe eceleni uma ukwemukelwa kwalobo bufakazi buzokwenza ukuqulwa kwecala kube ngokungenabulungisa noma ngandlela thile buphazamise ukufezwa kobulungisa.

zu.interpretation:
Isigaba 36 soMthetho-sisekelo sisebenza kuwo onke amalungelo asoHleni Lwamalungelo futhi sisebenza ngokulandela amagxathu amabili. Ilungelo elisoHleni Lwamalungelo linokubekelwa imingcele kuphela ngokomthetho othile osebenza kubantu bonke. Umthetho osebenza kubantu bonke wumthetho osebenza ngokulinganayo kubo bonke abantu ezweni futhi ongahloselwe abantu abathile kuphela. Umbuzo wokubuzwa uwukuthi ingabe ukubekelwa imingcele noma ukwenqatshelwa lelo lungelo kuqukethwe emthethweni othile osebenza kubantu bonke (isib. imithetho eshayiwe noma iziqondiso). Kuleli gxathu lokuqala akubhekwa ukuthi lowo mngcele uyafaneleka noma cha, kodwa kumane nje kuwumbuzo wokuthi ukhona yini kwakuba khona umngcele.

 

Uma ikhona imingcele, khona-ke kuzobhekwa ukuthi lowo mngcele unako yini ukucabangela okuhle futhi uyafaneleka yini emphakathini ovulekile nolawulwa ngentando yeningi ngokusekelwe kusithunzi (dignity) sobuntu, ukulingana nenkululeko, kucatshangelwa zonke izici eziphathelene nendaba okuhlanganisa ubunjalo belungelo, ukubaluleka kwenjongo yalowo mngcele; ubunjalo nobungako bomngcele; ukuhlobana phakathi komngcele nenjongo yawo nendlela yokuxegisa ukuze kufezwe leyo njongo.

 

Kungasemva kokuba sekuqhathaniswe kahle zonke lezi zici kanye nanoma ziphi ezinye izici eziphathelene nendaba lapho iNkantolo iyothola khona ukuthi lowo mngcele uyafaneleka yini ngokomthetho-sisekelo noma cha. Loku kubandakanya ukwahlulela ukuthi into ibaluleke kangakanani kanye nokuhlaziya ukuthi into kudingeka ibe ngakanani, okuyinto edinga ukubhalansa izithakazelo (interests) ezithintekayo. Okokugcina, isibopho sokuveza ubufakazi siphezu kwalolo hlangothi olufuna ukuba kusetshenziswe lowo mngcele. Ngakho-ke, kuyofuneka ukuba isishayamthetho sibonise ukuthi kungani umthetho olawula okuqukethwe kumafilimu ufanelekile ekuthiyeni ilungelo lenkululeko yokuveza okusenhliziyweni (freedom of expression).
zu.mechanism: Ngokwesibonelo, umthetho olawula loko okuqukethwe kumafilimu ubeke nemingcele kulawo mafilimu, ulibekela imingcele ilungelo lenkululeko yokuveza okusenhliziyweni. Nokho, uma injongo yalo mngcele iwukuvikela izingane ekubukeni izinto ezilimazayo, kuzophakama umbuzo wokuthi ingabe lo mthetho othiya ilungelo lenkululeko yokuveza okusenhliziyweni uyiwo yini umngcele ofanelekile ngokwesigaba 36 soMthetho-sisekelo. Uma lowo mthetho uvumelana kahle nezinto okukalwa ngazo zesigaba 36 soMthetho-sisekelo khona-ke lowo mngcele uyafaneleka ngokomthetho-sisekelo.
zu.snippet: Lesi sigaba sihlinzeka izimo lapho amalungelo aqakonyiswe oHleni Lwamalungelo (Bill of Rights) engase abekelwe khona imingcele.
zu.title: Ukuncishiswa kwamalungelo
zu.topic_meaning: Isigaba 36 soMthetho-sisekelo sihlinzeka izinto okukalwa ngazo ezimeni lapho amalungelo asoHleni Lwamalungelo (Bill of Rights) engase abekelwe khona imingcele. Amalungelo aqukethwe oHleni Lwamalungelo awayona into ewujuqu nakanjani okusho ukuthi anako ukubekelwa imingcele. Leyo mingcele kumele ivumelane nezinto okukalwa ngazo ezibekwe esigabeni 36 soMthetho-sisekelo ukuze ibhekwe njengefanelekile.

zu.legislation: It is also important to note that there is a difference between the declaration of a State of Emergency and the declaration of a State of National Disaster. The onslaught of the Covid-19 pandemic in 2020 caused the declaration of a National State of Disaster in terms of the Disaster Management Act 57 of 2002 whereas a State of Emergency may only be declared under the State of Emergency Act 64 of 1997, and section 37 of the Constitution, and only in very limited circumstances.
zu.snippet: Lesi sigaba sihlinzeka ukuthi kunini nangaphansi kwaziphi izimo lapho kumenyezelwa khona isimo esibucayi.
zu.title: Isigaba 37: Izimo ezibucayi
zu.topic_meaning:
Isigaba 37 soMthetho-sisekelo sihlinzeka ukuthi kunini nangaphansi kwaziphi izimo lapho kungase kumenyezelwe khona isimo esibucayi. Isimo esibucayi singamenyezelwa kuphela ngokuhlangabezana nemibandela ethile enqala ngokwalesi sigaba. Ukulengiswa okwesikhashana kwamalungelo abantu ayisisekelo kuyafaneleka uma kuwukuthi ukuphila kwesizwe kusongelwa yimpi, ukuhlaselwa, ukuvukelwa kombuso okusabalele, iziyaluyalu noma okunye okuphuthumayo emphakathini futhi leso simemezelo sidingekela ukubuyisela ukuthula nokuhleleka.

 

Ukumenyezelwa kwesimo esibucayi kungenziwa kuphela ngokoMthetho kaHulumeni futhi akufanele kuqhubeke ngaphezu kwezinsuku ezi-21 ngaphandle kokuba uMkhandlu Kazwelonke (National Assembly) unquma ukuselula futhi, nalapho, loko kwelulwa kumele kuhlangabezane nemibandela ethile.

 

Futhi lesi sigaba sihlinzeka iThebula Lamalungelo Angenakushalazelelwa futhi nanoma muphi umthetho oshayelwe ukufezekisa isimo esibucayi awunakuwashalazelela la malungelo ngokwezinga elihlinzekwe kuleli thebula, amanye amalungelo awanakushalazelelwa nhlobo. Ngokwesibonelo, ilungelo lokuphila alinakushalazelelwa ngisho nakancane.

zu.mechanism: In order to rely on section 38 of the Constitution, one does not need to prove that a right of a specific person or persons have been infringed or threatened – one only needs to allege that a right in the Bill of Rights has been infringed or threatened and provide support for this allegation.
zu.snippet: Relates to the enforcement of rights in the Bill of Rights in a court and sets out who can approach a court to allege that a right has been infringed.
zu.title: Ukuphoqelelwa kwamalungelo
zu.topic_meaning:
Section 38 of the Constitution relates to the enforcement of rights in the Bill of Rights in a competent court and sets out who can approach a court to allege that their, or another person’s, rights have been infringed or threatened. This section adopts a wide approach to standing and “threatened” indicates that a person may also approach a court if they believe there might be a future violation of a right in the Bill of Rights.

Persons who may approach a Court include: “anyone acting in their own interest; anyone acting on behalf of another person who cannot act in their own name; anyone acting as a member of, or in the interest of, a group or class of persons; anyone acting in the public interest and an association acting in the interest of its members”. The Court in such an instance may “grant appropriate relief, including a declaration of rights”.

zu.interpretation: Ukusetshenziswa komthetho wamazwe kubhekise kuko kokubili umthetho wamazwe oyisibopho nalowo ongesona isibopho mayelana nesiqondiso sendlela yokuqondakala. Ngokwesibonelo, iNingizimu Afrika yasayina futhi yemukela (okusho ukuthi ivuma ukuthi siyasebenza emthethweni waseNingizimu Afrika) iSivumelwano Samazwe Ngamalungelo Omphakathi Nawepollitki (International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights, [ICCPR]), esinika isiqondiso sendlela yokuqondakala kwamalungelo ahlukahlukene omphakathi nawezepolitiki. Uma umuntu ethi umthetho othile unyathela ilungelo lakhe elingokomthetho-sisekelo lokuba nengasese iNkantolo ibophekile ukunaka isiqondiso se-ICCPR kuleyo ndaba. Ngokuqondene nokusetshenziswa komthetho wakwamanye amazwe ngenjongo yesiqondiso endleleni yokuqondakala, inkantolo, inkundla noma isithangami kwenza ngokuzibonela ekuthini kubheke yini kulowo mthetho futhi kufanele kuqashelwe futhi kunakwe ngaso sonke isikhathi lapho kwenziwa noma kuphi ukuqhathanisa ukuthi izinhlelo zobulungisa (judicial systems) zingase zingafani.
zu.snippet: Lesi sigaba sinika isiqondiso sokuthi uHla Lwamalungelo (Bill of Rights) kufanele luqondakale kanjani.
zu.title: Isigaba 39: Ukuhunyushwa koMqulu wamaLungelo
zu.topic_meaning:
Isigaba 39(1) soMthetho-sisekelo sibeka isibopho phezu kwenkantolo, inkundla noma isithangami sokuthi lapho kuhlonzwa incazelo yoHla Lwamalungelo kubekwe phambili loko okubalulekile okusekela umphakathi ovulekile wentando yabantu ngokusekelwe esithunzini sobuntu, ukulingana, nenkululeko futhi sibeka isibopho kuleyo nkantolo, inkundla noma isithangami sokuba kucatshangelwe nomthetho wamazwe futhi sisho nokuthi sinako ukukhetha ukucabangela umthetho wakwamanye amazwe.

 

Isigaba 39(2) soMthetho-sisekelo sibeka isibopho phezu kwanoma yiphi inkantolo, inkundla noma isithangami lapho kuhlonzwa incazelo yanoma muphi umthetho oshayiwe, nalapho kuthuthukiswa umthetho-mvama (common law) noma umthetho ongokwesiko (customary law) sokuba kugqugquzelwe umoya nezinhloso zoHla Lwamalungelo. Isigaba 39(2) silawula ngokugudlisela ukusetshenziswa koHla Lwamalungelo futhi sivumela ukuba uthuthukiswe umthetho-mvama ngokuvumelana noHla Lwamalungelo. Lapho zisebenzisa isigaba 39(2) izinkantolo zencika kulawo magugu (values) ayisisekelo soHla Lwamalungelo bese zihlola ukuthi kuyadingeka yini ukuwuthuthukisa umthetho ukuze uvumelane kahle nala magugu angokomthetho-sisekelo.

 

Isigaba 39(3) soMthetho-sisekelo sihlinzeka ukuthi uHla Lwamalungelo alukuphiki ukuthi akhona amalungelo noma izinkululeko kumthetho-mvama, umthetho ongokwesiko noma umthetho oshayiwe kodwa nokho kuphela ngezinga ovumelana ngalo noHla Lwamalungelo.

zu.interpretation: Kubalulekile ukuqonda ukuthi eziwombeni ezihlukahlukene iNkantolo Yomthetho-sisekelo iye yakuqinisekisa ukuthi ukwehlukanisa okungafani ngaso sonke isikhathi phakathi kwezakhamuzi nalabo abangezona izakhamuzi akuhambisani noMthetho-sisekelo nokuthi iningi lamalungelo asoHleni Lwamalungelo atholakalela wonke umuntu.
zu.legislation: The State is obliged to enact national legislation to define citizenship and the South African Citizenship Act 88 of 1995 provides for how one can acquire, lose and regain South African citizenship. The recognition of the right to citizenship as a founding provision in the Constitution must be understood in its historical context. During apartheid, black South Africans were not recognised as citizens of South Africa and were made citizens of defined territories (known as Homelands) under the Bantu Homelands Citizenship Act 26 of 1970.
zu.snippet: Isisekelo sokuba ukuba yisakhamuzi saseNingizimu Afrika kube yinto efanayo kubo bonke.
zu.title: Isigaba 3: Ubuzwe
zu.topic_meaning:
Isigaba 3 soMthetho-sisekelo sibalula ukuthi ukuba yisakhamuzi kuyinto efanayo kubo bonke nanokuthi zonke izakhamuzi zaseNingizimu Afrika akukona kuphela ukuthi “zinelungelo ngokulinganayo lokujabulela amalungelo (rights), amalungelo okuvunyelwa (privileges) nezinzuzo zokuba yisakhamuzi” kodwa futhi “zithweswe ngokulinganayo izibopho nemithwalo okuza ngokuba yisakhamuzi.”

Ngaphansi kohlelo olusha lomthetho-sisekelo eNingizimu Afrika, ilungelo lokuba yisakhamuzi ngokoMthetho-sisekelo lisekelwe ekuqapheleni ukuthi bonke abantu bayalingana. Ilungelo lokuba yisakhamuzi livumela umuntu ukuba akwazi ukufinyelela amalungelo ahlukahlukene njengelungelo lokumelelwa ngokwepolitiki kanye nelungelo lokusuka kwenye indawo uye kwenye nendawo yokuhlala.

zu.snippet: Ukuhlinzekela ihubo lesizwe laseNingizimu Afrika.
zu.title: Isigaba 4: Iculo Lesizwe
zu.topic_meaning:
Kuze kube wu-1994 ihubo lesizwe elisemthethweni kwakuyi-Die stem van Suid-Afrika elalisekelwe enkondlweni ka-CJ Langenhoven yango-1918. Ngo-1994, owayewuMengameli Nelson Mandela wamemezela ukuthi ukwenezela ku-Die stem van Suid-Afrika nelithi Nkosi Sikelel’ IAfrika kwakuzoba yihubo lesizwe. Ingoma ethi Nkosi Sikelel’ IAfrika kwakuyiculo lesonto okwathi kamuva lahlotshaniswa eduze ne-African National Congress futhi lavama ukuculwa lapho kuklolodelwa uhulumeni wobandlululo. Ngo-1997, owayewuMengameli Nelson Mandela wamemezela ngokusemthethweni ihubo lesizwe elisha leRiphabliki YaseNingizimu Afrika, eliyinhlanganisela ye-Nkosi Sikelel’ IAfrika ne-Die stem van Suid-Afrika (“The Call of South Africa”).

Ihubo lesizwe libonisa ukuzimisela [kwabantu] ukuba kwelashwe ukwehlukana kwesikhathi esidlule njengoba kubekwe kuSendlalelo soMthetho-Sisekelo.

zu.snippet: Ukuhlinzekela ifulege lesizwe laseNingizimu Afrika
zu.title: Isigaba 5: Ifulegi yesizwe
zu.topic_meaning: Isigaba 5 soMthetho-sisekelo sihlinzeka ukuthi ifulege lesizwe laseRiphabliki linemibala omnyama, oyigolide, oluhlaza okotshani, omhlophe, obomvu noluhlaza okwesibhakabhaka, njengoba kuchazwe kwadwetshwa ku-Schedule 1 yoMthetho-sisekelo. Leli fulege lesizwe laklanywa ngowayeyiBika (Herald) Lombuso WaseNingizimu Afrika, uMnu. Fred Brownwell. Leli fulege lasetshenziswa okokuqala ngomhla ka-27 Ephreli 1994 kanti umklamo oyinhloko waleli fulege, onesakhiwo esiwu-‘V’ ohamba udibane bese uba yibhande elilodwa elivundlile ngokwezinto ezisemthethweni ezishicilelwa wuHulumeni, unokuhunyushwa “njengokuhlangana ndawonye kwezici ezihlukahlukene ezisemphakathini waseNingizimu Afrika, bese ziqhubekela phambili ngobunye”.

zu.legislation: The Use of Official Languages Act 12 of 2012 has been specifically enacted to give effect to the constitutional obligations in terms of section 6 of the Constitution. The National Language Policy Framework was adopted in 2002 by Cabinet. Some of the aims of this policy are to promote the equitable use of the 11 official languages and to ensure redress for previously marginalised official languages.
zu.mechanism: Isigaba 6 soMthetho-sisekelo ubuye ubophezele ukwakhiwa kweBhodi Lezilimi ZaseNingizimu Afrika Ezihlangene (Pan South African Language Board) okumele ligqugquzele futhi lakhe izimo ezivumela ukuthuthuka kwazo zonke izilimi ezisemthethweni kuhlanganise nezilimi zesiKhoi, isiNama nezabaThwa kanye nolimi lwezandla. Ukuqashelwa [ngokusemthethweni] koLimi Lwezandla LwaseNingizimu Afrika (“SASL”) njengolimi olusemthethweni lwe-12 kwakuloku kuyindaba elengayo eside isikhathi kwase kuthi ngo-2017, iKomiti Elihlangene Lokubuyekezwa Komthetho-sisekelo lePhalamende latusa ukuba i-SASL iqashelwe njengolimi olusemthethweni lwe-12 okuyinto eyayizobizela ukuchibiyelwa komthetho-sisekelo.
zu.snippet: Ukuqashelwa kwezilimi ezisemthethweni zaseNingizimu Afrika
zu.title: Isigaba 6: Izilimi
zu.topic_meaning:
Isigaba 6 soMthetho-sisekelo siqaphela “isiPedi, isiTswana, isiSwazi, isiVenda, isiTsonga, isiBhunu, isiNgisi, isiNdebele, isiXhosa nesiZulu” njengezilimi ezisemthethweni zaseRiphabliki YaseNingizimu Afrika. Lesi sigaba siyakuqaphela futhi nokuthi “ngokomlando kuye kwancishiswa ukusetshenziswa kwezilimi zomdabu kanye nesithunzi sazo” bese sibophezela uMbuso ukuba uthathe “izinyathelo ezinokwenzeka nezingokoqobo zokuphakamisa isithunzi sezilimi zomdabu nokwandisa ukusetshenziswa kwazo”. Uhulumeni kazwelonke nabesifundazwe baphinde babophezelwe ukuba “bakulawule futhi bakuqaphe ukusebenzisa kwabo izilimi ezisemthethweni” ngokuthatha izinyathelo zokushaya umthetho nezinye futhi zonke izilimi ezisemthethweni kumele ziphathwe ngesilinganiso 

Ukuqaphela ukuthi ezithile izilimi zomdabu zabekwa esimeni sokunyathelwa ngokwezinhlelo zezwe, isigaba 6(2) soMthetho-sisekelo ubeka isibopho phezu koMbuso ukuba uthathe izinyathelo ezinokwenzeka zokuphakamisa isithunzi salezi zilimi. Ezinye izilimi ezikhulunywa ngabambalwa eNingizimu Afrika, njengesiHindi nesiGreki, azibalwa njengezilimi ezisemthethweni. Loku kungenxa yokuthi zona ziyakhulunywa kwezinye izingxenye zomhlaba okwenza ukuqhubeka kwazo ziphila kunganciki ekusetshenzisweni nokukhula eNingizimu Afrika.

Isigaba 6(4) sibizela ukuba zonke izilimi ezisemthethweni ziphathwe ngokulinganayo.

zu.interpretation: Isigaba 7 sibophezela uMbuso ukuba uhloniphe, uvikele, ugqugquzele futhi ufezekise la malungelo asoHleni Lwamalungelo. Ngakho-ke, uMbuso awubizelwa kuphela ukuba ugweme ukuphazamisa amalungelo abanye, kodwa unesibopho ngokuqondile sokubuye uwagqugquzele lawo malungelo. Isibopho sokuvikela sibizela ukuba uMbuso uvikele amalungelo omuntu ekuphazanyisweni ngomunye umuntu. Isibopho sokugqugquzela sike sichazwe njengesibopho sokuqwashisa abanye ngamalungelo ngokusebenzisa izinhlelo zokufundisa. Isibopho sokufezekisa sibizela ukuba uMbuso uthathe isinyathelo futhi usebenzise izindlela ezifanelekile zokushaya imithetho, zasekuphathweni kwabantu wuhulumeni, zokwenza izabelo-mali, zokwahlulela zokugqugquzela nokunye okunjalo ukuze abantu njengamanje abangawajabuleli ngokugcwele futhi bawafinyelele amalungelo abo bakwazi ukwafinyelela.
zu.mechanism: Amalungelo asoHleni Lwamalungelo angase abekelwe imingcele kuye ngokuthi leyo mingcele iyahlangabezana yini nezimfuneko zesivivinyo esihlinzekelwe loko esigabeni 36 soMthetho-sisekelo. Amalungelo athile adinga ukuba acaciswe ngaphakathi, njengelungelo lokuba nendlu. Nokho, kubalulekile ukuthi nanoma muphi umngcele obekelwa ilungelo elisoHleni Lwamalungelo livivinywe ngokwesigaba 36 soMthetho-sisekelo ukuze kuhlolwe ukuthi lowo mngcele uyafaneleka noma awunakuvunyelwa ngokomthetho-sisekelo.
zu.snippet: UHla Lwamalungelo (Bill of Rights) “luyinsika yombuso wentando yeningi eNingizimu Afrika”.
zu.title: Isigaba 7: Amalungelo
zu.topic_meaning: Isigaba 7 soMthetho-sisekelo sihlinzeka ukuthi uHla Lwamalungelo “luyinsika yombuso wentando yeningi eNingizimu Afrika” nanokuthi lolu Hla Lwamalungelo “lugcizelela amalungelo abo bonke ezweni lakithi futhi luqinisekise izici eziyigugu okuwukuthi isithunzi somuntu, ukulingana nenkululeko”.

zu.interpretation: Amanye amalungelo angokomthetho-sisekelo njengelungelo lokuba nengasese ayaphoqeleleka phakathi kwabantu ngabanye. Phakathi kwabantu ngabanye kukhona isibopho sokulihlonipha leli lungelo. Lolu hlobo lokusetshenziswa koHla Lwamalungelo lwaziwa ngokuthi wukusetshenziswa okuvundlile (parallel) koHla Lwamalungelo. Uma uHla Lwamalungelo lusebenza ngokuvundlile, alugcini ngokunika amalungelo kubantu ngasese, kodwa futhi lubeka kubo izibopho zokuhlonipha amalungelo asoHleni Lwamalungelo, okungenani ezimeni ezithile. Ngamanye amazwi, uma uHla Lwamalungelo lusebenza ngokuvundlile, kokubili uMbuso nabantu ngasese babophekile ngokwalolu Hla Lwamalungelo.
zu.mechanism: Ngokwesibonelo, uMbuso kumele uqinisekise ukuthi isakhamuzi ngasinye sinalo ilungelo lokuvota ezinkethweni futhi loku kuyisibopho esinokufezwa wuMbuso kuphela. UMbuso akufanelekile uncishe isakhamuzi leli lungelo. Lolu hlobo lokusetshenziswa koHla Lwamalungelo lwaziwa ngokuthi wukusetshenziswa okumi phuhle (vertical) koHla Lwamalungelo, okusho ukuvikelwa komuntu ngamunye emandleni oMbuso. Uma uHla Lwamalungelo lusebenza ngokumi phuhle, lunika amalungelo kubantu ngabanye futhi lubeka izibopho phezu koMbuso ukuba uhloniphe, uvikele, ugqugquzele futhi ufezekise la malungelo asoHleni Lwamalungelo.
zu.snippet: Lapha kuxoxwa ngokuthi uHla Lwamalungelo (Bill of Rights) lusebenza kobani.
zu.title: Isigaba 8: Ukusebenza kwawo
zu.topic_meaning: Isigaba 8 soMthetho-sisekelo sibalula ukuthi uHla Lwamalungelo, iSahluko 2 soMthetho-sisekelo “sisebenza kuwo wonke umthetho futhi sibopha isishayamthetho, isigungu esiphezulu, izikhungo zokwahlulela nazo zonke izingxenye zombuso. Okubalulekile, uHla Lwamalungelo lubeka isibopho hhayi phezu koMbuso kuphela kodwa futhi nakubantu abangokwemvelo (abantu nje) noma abangokomthetho (izinkampani noma ezinye izikhungo ezisazinkampani), ngokwalelo zinga okusebenza ngalo kube kucatshangelwa “ubunjalo balelo lungelo kanje nobunjalo baleso sibopho esibekwe lapho”. Okwenza kubalwe konke loku wukuqaphela ukuthi ngezinye izikhathi abantu noma izikhungo ezingasese, hhayi uMbuso kuphela, kunokwenzeka kube namandla amakhulu bese kunyathela amalungelo abanye.

zu.interpretation: Isiqinisekiso esingokomthetho-sisekelo selungelo lokulingana lisekelwa wumbono (concept) wokulingana okuya ngesimo (substantive equality). Umbono ojwayelekile wokulingana nse ubizela ukuthi abantu ngabanye baphathwe ngokulingana kungakhathaliseki izimo zabo. Nokho, ukuphathwa ngokulinganayo okufana ncimishi kukodwa akwanele ukuze kufinyelelwe umgomo womphakathi olinganayo lowo ohlosiwe ngokoMthetho-sisekelo. Ukulingana okuya ngesimo kugxile ekufinyeleleni imiphumela elinganayo hhayi ekuphathweni ngokulinganayo kuphela. Izithiyo ezivimbela ukulingana kwemiphumela lezo abantu ababhekene nazo, ezinjengomlando wokubandlululwa okungenabulungisa, ziyacatshangelwa. Ukulingana nse akukunaki ukuthi ukungabikho kobulungisa kwezenhlalo yomphakathi, ngokomnotho nangokomlando kubathinta ngezindlela ezingafani abantu ngabanye nokuthi izinyathelo zokuzama ukuthuthukisa ukulingana kulindeleke ukuba zisize ekuzilungiseni lezi zithiyo ezingokoqobo. Ukulingana okuya ngesimo kunokufinyelelwa kuphela ngokusingatha lezi zithiyo ezingokoqobo.
zu.legislation: The Promotion of Equality and Prevention of Unfair Discrimination Act 4 of 2000 is the constitutionally mandated legislation adopted pursuant to section 9(4) of the Constitution to give effect to the constitutional prohibition against unfair discrimination.
zu.snippet: Lapha kubekwa obala ilungelo labantu bonke lokulingana
zu.title: Isigaba 9: Ukulingana
zu.topic_meaning: Isigaba 9 soMthetho-sisekelo sivikela ilungelo lokulingana kwabantu. Isigaba 9(1) “sihlinzeka ukuthi wonke umuntu unelungelo lokuthola ukuvikeleka okulinganayo nosizo lomthetho.” Isigaba 9(2) sihlinzekela izinyathelo zokulungisa okumele zithathwe ukuze kwenziwe ngcono isimo salawo maqembu aye abhekana nokubandlululwa esikhathini esidlule. Ngaphezu kwaloko, isigaba 9(3) senqabela ukubandlululwa okungenabulungisa okusekelwe ezicini ezinjengohlanga, ukuthambekela ngokocansi, ubulili nenkolelo. Lolu akulona uhla oluphelele lwezizathu abantu abangase babandlululwe ngazo. UMbuso ubophekile ukuthatha izinyathelo zokushaya imithetho nezinye ukuze kuvikelwe futhi kuthuthukiswe izigaba ezithile zabantu abaye bacindezeleka esikhathini esidlulile.

zu.interpretation: It should be noted that separation of powers is not an absolute principle. Thus, there is not a complete divide between the three branches of government and there is often an overlap. For example, in cases where Parliament has enacted legislation which the courts declare not to be in line with the Constitution, Parliament will be ordered to redraft the relevant parts of the legislation.
zu.snippet: This principle sees State power divided between the legislative branch, the executive branch and the judiciary.
zu.title: Separation of Powers
zu.topic_meaning: South Africa’s new constitutional order provides for a clear distinction between the three branches of the government in order to limit an over-concentration of State power in any one branch and to recognise the functional independence of the three branches of government. This doctrine of separation of powers sees State power divided between the legislative branch (which drafts the law), the executive branch (which implements the law) and the judiciary (which interprets and resolves dispute of the law). This doctrine allows for checks and balances to be carried out by each branch over the others, and ensures that no branch of government can usurp the power of another. Although not specifically mentioned in the Constitution, the doctrine of separation of powers is an essential component of the foundation of South African constitutional law.

zu.interpretation:
Many court decisions have stressed the importance of separation of powers amongst the different arms of government and checks and balances that allow the other arms of government and the public to monitor and review the National Assembly in its functions.
Although members of the NA are elected under a political party or self-sponsored, they are allowed to support the views of another political party by floor-crossing.
zu.legislation:
Sections 46-59 discuss the role of the National Assembly in detail and the legislation that gives effect to it includes:
(a) Electoral Commission Act 51 of 1996 
(b) Electoral Act 73 of 1998 
(c) Local Government: Municipal Structures Act 117 of 1998
(d) Constitution Fifteenth Amendment Act of 2008
(e) Constitution Tenth Amendment Act of 2003
(f) Rules of the National Assembly
zu.snippet:
Sections 46-59 of the Constitution govern the National Assembly, which is the first House of Parliament, with the second House being the National Council of Provinces (NCOP). The National Assembly is the primary legislative power in Parliament and the house to which the national executive is accountable. They provide for:
(a) its composition and membership; 
(b) the duration of its term; 
(c) its meetings and business;
(d) the powers and privileges of its members; and 
(e) the checks and balances that can be exercised over it by the executive and members of the public.
zu.title: The National Assembly
zu.topic_meaning:
Composition and membership of the National Assembly 
The NA consists of 350 to 400 members who are elected every five years. 
Every South African who is qualified to vote (i.e. any citizen who is 18 years or older) is eligible to be a member of the NA. However, there are five exceptions:
(a) those in the service of the State, except the President, Deputy President, Ministers, and Deputy Ministers;
(b) permanent delegates to the National Council of Provinces or members of a provincial legislature or a Municipal Council;
(c) unrehabilitated insolvents;
(d) anyone declared to be of unsound mind by a court of the Republic; or
(e) anyone convicted of an offence and sentenced to more than 12 months' imprisonment without the option of a fine, either in South Africa or another country provided the conduct is also considered an offence in South Africa.
These persons may be allowed to be NA members in terms of national legislation that prescribes the limitations and conditions of their membership. 
After the election, the members are sworn into office by the Chief Justice or a judge designated by the Chief Justice. The oath or affirmation requires members of Parliament to affirm their loyalty to the State, and obedience to the Constitution, before assuming their duties. 
A person would lose their membership in the NA if they cease to be eligible; if they are absent from the Assembly without permission; or if they cease to be a member of the party that nominated them to be a member of the Assembly. 

Duration and term
The NA’s term of office lasts for five years, but the term may end earlier.  The President or Acting President has the power to end the term of office of the NA before the expiry of the five-year term if the conditions in sections 50(1) and 50(2) of the Constitution are met.

Meetings and business
The NA meetings are chaired by the speaker and deputy speaker. The Speaker and Deputy Speaker are elected from among the members of the NA.
Section 53 states that a majority (more than half) of the members must be present before a decision can be taken by the Assembly. Questions before the Assembly must be decided by a majority vote.
Powers and Privileges
The NA has two principal functions, as set out in section 55 of the Constitution. The first is to exercise legislative authority by considering, passing, amending or rejecting any legislation before it, and by initiating or preparing new legislation itself (except for money bills). Parliament’s second primary function is to maintain oversight of the national executive authority and any organ of the State.
The Assembly has the power to control its internal arrangements, proceedings and procedures, according to the Rules of the National Assembly. The salaries of the members of the NA are charged directly from the National Revenue Fund, which helps to ensure that members are independent and impartial in their duties.
Section 58 grants the Assembly’s members immunity (legal protection) from being held liable either criminally or civilly for violations of law or for anything they say or reveal in the Assembly or any of its committees. This allows members to exercise free speech and speak up on behalf of their constituents without the fear of facing criminal and civil actions. Other immunities are prescribed by law.

Checks and balances by the Executive and members of the public
The Constitution gives the executive and the public the power to oversee the Assembly by reviewing and monitoring the performance of its functions.
Members of the executive arm of government (President, members of the Cabinet or Deputy Ministers) have the power to oversee the Assembly’s performance by attending and speaking in the Assembly. 
The public can also oversee the NA. Section 59 requires the NA to conduct its business in an open manner and to facilitate public involvement and participation in the law-making process. The Assembly may only exclude the public from involvement if it is reasonable and justifiable, in a democratic society, to do so.

zu.interpretation:
In Doctors for Life International v Speaker of the National Assembly and Others 2006 (6) SA 416 (CC), s 67 was used to illustrate  the principle of co-operation and communication in the national legislative process. This provision describes how local government is involved in NCOP proceedings, albeit indirectly. In this way, the NCOP also represents the concerns and interests of local government in addition to the provinces.
In the same judgment, DFL challenged the passing of legislation by parliament on the basis that the NCOP had not allowed for sufficient public participation in terms of s 72. The constitutional court found that s 72 demands meaningful public participation, and the NCOP's failure to carry out public consultations before passing the bill resulted in the invalidation of some of the legislation in question.
zu.legislation:
Importantly, Schedule 4 of the Constitution stipulates functional areas of concurrent national and provincial legislative competence and this includes housing, health services and education (excluding tertiary education). This means that both the national and provincial governments can legislate on these areas. The NCOP may initiate and prepare new legislation concerning the areas listed in this Schedule.

The Powers, Privileges and Immunities Act No. 4 of 2004 sets out certain powers, privileges and immunities of Parliament, including delegates to the NCOP and members of provincial legislatures; and provides for incidental matters.

The Rules of the National Council of Provinces provides for the processes, structure and sittings of the NCOP.
zu.snippet: Sections 60-72 of the Constitution concern the structure, powers, processes and functions of the National Council of Provinces (NCOP). The NCOP represents provincial interests in Parliament and is deeply involved in the passing of new Bills, especially where they affect the provinces or amend the Constitution, which is dealt with by ss 73-77 (for more on this, see the guide to Parliament and Legislative Competence).
zu.title: The National Council of Provinces
zu.topic_meaning:
The NCOP consists of a delegation of 10 members for each of the 9 provinces in South Africa. Section 60 stipulates that these delegates must include 6 permanent delegates and 4 special delegates. 

According to ss 61 and 62, the special delegates must include the Premier of the province (or a member of the provincial legislature of that province, appointed by the Premier in her place), and 3 other special delegates, who are appointed by the provincial legislature of that province. The permanent delegates may not necessarily be members of the provincial legislature, but they must be eligible for that role. If they are members of the provincial legislature, they automatically lose that position as soon as they are appointed as a permanent delegate in the NCOP. Section 64 states that the NCOP must elect a Chairperson and a Deputy Chairperson from among the permanent delegates. There must also be a second Deputy Chairperson who serves for only 1 year, and who must be succeeded by someone from a different province so that each province gets a turn.

The NCOP exercises legislative power in two ways: by initiating and preparing new legislation in an area listed in Schedule 4 of the Constitution, or by considering, passing, rejecting or amending legislation that came from the National Assembly (s 68).  The Premier (or her designated representative) heads the delegation for each province and casts a vote on behalf of that province when the NCOP makes decisions. Each province gets one vote, and decisions must be supported by at least 5 provinces (s 65). Members of Cabinet, Deputy Ministers and municipal representatives may attend sessions and speak in the NCOP, but they may not vote (ss 66 and 67). 

The NCOP also has wide powers to conduct its proceedings in its own ways and determine its own rules (S 70). Section 69 gives the NCOP the power to summon any person to give evidence during its proceedings, and may receive petitions or submissions by any person. Like the members of the National Assembly, NCOP members have parliamentary privileges and immunities (s 71), which means that an NCOP member has free speech and can't be held civilly or criminally liable for what they say or produce before the NCOP or its committees. The NCOP also has important obligations, however, which include the duty to facilitate public participation in its processes and to conduct its business in an open and transparent way (s 72).

zu.interpretation:
In Doctors for Life International v Speaker of the House of Assembly, the Constitutional Court cites Section 73 as part of the “National Legislative Process” in which “all Bills, constitutional amendments, Bills affecting and not affecting provinces and money Bills are dealt with, together with assent to Bills and the publication and safekeeping of Acts.”
In Ex Parte President of the Republic of South Africa: In re Constitutionality of the Liquor Bill, the Constitutional Court interpreted section 76 of the Constitution as placing more influence on the National Council of Provinces, mainly though invoking the Mediation Committee. The Court also held that if the President has reservations about a Bill's constitutionality, the President can refer it to the Constitutional Court only after Parliament has reconsidered it in the light of his reservations, to no avail.
In Tongoane and Others v National Minister for Agriculture and Land Affairs and Others, the Constitutional Court interpreted the section 76 procedure to govern Bills whose provisions substantially affect the interests of the provinces. The substantiality can be established via the "pith and substance" test, which looks to the effect of the subject-matter of the legislation.
In President of the Republic of South Africa and Others v United Democratic Movement (African Christian Democratic Party and Others Intervening; Institute for Democracy in South Africa and Another as Amici Curiae), the Constitutional Court held that in the case of abstract review in terms of section 80, only the Constitutional Court is empowered to suspend the operation of impugned provisions until the challenge is resolved.
zu.legislation: The Money Bills Amendment Procedure and Related Matters Act, [No. 9 of 2009] provides for a procedure to amend money bills before Parliament, as well as for norms and standards for amending money Bills before provincial legislatures.
zu.snippet: The Constitution outlines various procedures in the introduction, adoption, and general handling of various bills in the National Assembly and the National Council of Provinces.
zu.title: The National Legislative Process
zu.topic_meaning:
The national legislative process is explained by Sections 73 - 82 of the Constitution. Different Bills will go through different routes, depending on where they originated, what they seek to do, and whether or not they affect the provinces. These processes are further expanded and dealt with by the Rules of the National Assembly and the Rules of the National Council of Provinces.

Section 73 of the Constitution dictates who can introduce any Bill in the National Assembly (NA) and the National Council of Provinces (NCOP). It states that only a Cabinet member, a Deputy Minister, or a member or committee of the National Assembly, can introduce a Bill in the National Assembly. Only the Cabinet member responsible for national financial matters may introduce either a Money Bill or a Bill which provides for legislation expected in section 214 of the Constitution (equitable shares and allocations of revenue). Only a member or committee of the National Council of Provinces (NCOP) may introduce a Bill in the Council referred to in section 76(3), besides the Bills that may be introduced in the NA. If there is a need, a Bill passed by the NA must be referred to the NCOP. A Bill passed by the Council must be referred to the NA.

Section 74 sets out the process for amending the Constitution. The process is rigorous, which reflects the seriousness of constitutional changes. It states that any Bill amending s 1 of the Constitution, or s 74, can only be passed by the NA and the NCOP together, with a supporting vote of at least 75 per cent of NA members and a supporting vote of at least six provinces in the NCOP. A Bill amending any provision in Ch 2 (the Bill of Rights) requires a supporting vote of at least two-thirds of NA members and a supporting vote of at least six provinces in the NCOP. Any Bill amending the Constitution must also be referred to the President for assent.

Section 75 of the Constitution sets out the procedure to be followed by the NCOP after the NA passes Ordinary Bills not affecting provinces. On receipt of such a bill, the NCOP must deal with the Bill in one of three ways:

  1. pass the Bill without amendments and submit it for presidential assent; or
  2. pass the Bill subject to amendments, which requires the NA to reconsider the Bill and pass the Bill again with or without amendments and submit it for presidential assent; or decide not to proceed with the Bill; or
  3. reject the Bill. 

Section 76 covers the procedure for when the NA passes an ordinary bill affecting provinces, other than a money bill. Such a Bill must be reported to the NCOP, which must then pass the Bill, pass an amended Bill, or reject the Bill. If the NCOP passes the Bill without amendment, the Bill must be sent to the President for assent. If the NCOP amends the bill, the bill must be sent to the NA and if the NA passes the amended Bill, it is sent to the President for assent. If the NCOP rejects the Bill, or if the NA refuses to pass an amended Bill, the Bill or the amended Bill must be referred to the Mediation Committee. 

The Mediation Committee may agree on the Bill as passed by the NA, the amended Bill as passed by the NCOP, or a different version of the Bill. Section 78 deals with the Mediation Committee, who may be part of the Committee and how it can agree on a version of a Bill or decide on a question during the national legislative process. The Mediation Committee consists of nine members of the NA, elected by the Assembly, and one delegate from each provincial delegation in the NCOP. The Committee will only have officially agreed on a Bill or a question if the Bill, or one side of the question, is supported by at least five of the representatives of the NA and at least five of the representatives of the NCOP. The mediation must be completed within 30 days and if the two houses still disagree after mediation, the original bill lapses. The bill may, however, still become law if it is passed again by two-thirds of the NA. This requirement prevents the NCOP from having absolute power over such bills, but it means that the NCOP can delay the passage of the bills and force a two-thirds majority in the NA for the bill to be passed. 

Section 77 deals with so-called ‘money bills’, which is any bill that appropriates money; imposes national taxes, levies, duties or surcharges; abolishes or reduces any national taxes, levies, duties or surcharges; or authorises direct charges against the National Revenue Fund. These Bills can only deal with these issues or subordinate matters incidental to them. Money bills are dealt with in the same way as ordinary bills not affecting the provinces.

Section 79 of the Constitution concerns what the President can do with new Bills. The President can either assent (agree) to the new Bill and sign it, or refer it back to the NA for reconsideration if he/she has reservations about the constitutionality. If the Bill referred to the NA included matters that relate to the NCOP, then the NCOP must participate in the reconsideration of the Bill. Once the Bill is reconsidered and sent back to the President, he/she can either assent to and sign it or, if he/she still has reservations about it, send it to the Constitutional Court for a decision on its constitutionality. If the Constitutional Court decides that the Bill is constitutional, then the President must assent to and sign it.

Sections 80 and 81 state that when a Bill is assented to and signed by the President, it becomes an Act of Parliament. It must then be published promptly and takes effect when it is published in the Government Gazette. The signed copy of the Act is conclusive evidence of the provisions of that Act and must be kept at the Constitutional Court.

If an Act is passed and members of the NA are concerned about its constitutionality, s 82 provides that they may apply to the Constitutional Court for an order declaring that all or part of it is unconstitutional. However, such an application must be supported by at least one-third of NA members and must be made within 30 days of the President assenting to and signing the Act.
